page.title: 05B.M.X. TRACK IN ANSTEY.
page.content:
A B.M.X is a type of bicycle specially designed for doing stunts such as wheelies. A wheelie is where you lift wheel up and ride along. The bike has got thick tyres for better grip and stability. At the Martin High School, Anstey there is a B.M.X. track. It has two quarter pipes, a red one and a white one. A quarter pie is is a ramp that goes up at 50 degrees in the air. There are lots of tricks you can do on it. It is about 2 metres high. There are lots of different kinds of B.M.X. bikes. The main makes include Raleigh, Mongoose, Diamond Back and Kuwahara. The differences between freestyle racing and racing is that freestyle is stunts and racing is racing around a B.M.X track.
Mark Hoggar and Craig Wood. Aged 9.
